description: From Middle English houshold, equivalent to house +‎ hold. Cognate with Scots houshald, housald, housell, howsell (“household”), Dutch huishouden (“household”), German Low German Huushollen (“household”), German Haushalt (“household”), Swedish hushåll (“household, family”), Norwegian husholdning (“household”).

entries.meaning: Belonging to the same house and family.
Found in or having its origin in a home.
Widely known to the public; familiar.
examples: a household word; a household name

entries.meaning: Collectively, all the persons who live in a given house; a family including attendants, servants etc.; a domestic or family establishment.
examples: And calls, without affecting airs, / His household twice a day to prayers.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A line of ancestry; a race or house.
